subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description: Support to the Jamaica Violence Prevention Peace and Sustainable Development  Programme (JSPD).The programme will strengthen the capacity of the GoJ and civil society to adopt a multi sectoral approach to armed violence prevention by enhancing the design of policies, building capacity of institutions, increasing the effectiveness of donor support, targeting community interventions and developing an integrated UN Country Team programme.

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description:
o	Ministry of National Security to develop policy and implement community safety and crime prevention programmes.
o	National Security Strategy Implementation Unit to coordinate the implementation of the National Security Policy.
o	Jamaica Constabulary Force and National Firearm Licensing Authority to control small arms.
o	Civil society organisations to conduct advocacy and deliver services in communities.
o	Parliamentary sub-committee to provide oversight of government actions. 
o	Organised Crime Watch at University of West Indies to conduct research and inform policy.
subproject.title: Increased InstitutionCapacity

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description: i) Increase the capacity of the Government to coordinate the government, civil society and donor response to the crisis ii) support the Office of the Public Defender to engage independent forensic pathologists to observe autopsies of civilians killed in the security operation iii) produce a report on the economic cost of the violence iv) support a cash-for-work project to repair the main market and other basic infrastructure damaged in the violence v) conduct preparatory work for a broad-based and inclusive national dialogue to ensure that May 2010 GoJ commitments on good governance are implemented vi) explore options for truth and reconciliation to help build trust and social cohesion
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Effective Response to Crisis
